The Three Doubts at the End of Life of the Venerable Cizhao The Venerable Cizhao, the Master of the School, said: Those who recite the Buddha's name have three doubts at the end of their lives and are not reborn in the Pure Land.
First, they doubt:
I have committed extremely grave karma in my life.
My practice has been shallow for only a short time.
I'm afraid I won't be able to be reborn there.
Second, they doubt:
Although I have recited the name of Amitabha Buddha,
There may be some wishes in my mind that are not yet fulfilled.
And my greed, anger, and delusion have not yet ceased.
I'm afraid I won't be reborn there.
Third, they doubt:
Although I have recited the name of Amitabha Buddha,
When my life is about to end,
I'm afraid the Buddha will not come to welcome me.
Because of these three doubts,
The doubts become obstacles.
Will lose their right mindfulness.
And will not be able to be reborn.
Therefore, those who recite the Buddha's name must sincerely believe in the clear meaning of the Buddha's sutras.

The master said:

One should simply let go of body and mind,

Whenever one encounters illness,
One should contemplate impermanence,
Single-mindedly await death,

Admonishing with verbal karma, reciting the Buddha's name with the mouth is like spitting out pearls and jade, with the reward of rebirth in the heavens and buddha lands. Expounding the teachings and transforming others with the mouth is like emitting light to break through people's confusion and darkness. Talking about useless things with the mouth is like chewing wood shavings, and it is better to remain silent to preserve one's qi. Liking to joke and jest with the mouth is like brandishing a knife, which can injure one's mouth. Speaking foul language with the mouth is like flowing maggots, with the retribution of rebirth in the hells and as an animal. Speaking good things with the mouth is like spraying fresh fragrance, praising others' virtues, and speaking truthfully with the mouth is like unfurling silk, truly benefiting others. Speaking deceptively with the mouth is like stepping on a trap, which can lead to error in one's actions. Speaking evil things with the mouth is like emitting a foul smell, criticizing others' faults. People's lives do not go beyond the body, mind, and mouth karma.
Killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct are the three karmic actions of the body.

they are called the ten wholesome deeds.
